rep.text: Finally! An interesting find! All these graduates probably think it's a lame piece of parchment!
Well, it does look like a boring piece of parchment, if I'm honest...
So what? It's not what it's made of that's important. It's what's on it and why they placed it here.
And do you have any idea why?
Look at these symbols on the wall around pedestal. They represent Ar'Dha - one of the Ju'ji gods.
I have spent my whole life researching their religion and usually they place these symbols around objects they believe cursed and may harm others to protect them.
I don't believe in magic, but they probably put the map here to protect others from the curse it bares.
Let's take it and get out of here, I don't think there is anything else interesting in these ruins....
